finance.title: Big banks all pass the Federal Reserve's stress tests, but the tests were less vigorous this year
finance.snippet: All the major banks passed the Federal Reserve's annual “stress tests” of the financial system, the central bank said Friday, but the test was less vigorous than in previous years.  The Fed said it used a less vigorous test because the global economy has weakened.

technology.title: New particle detector passes the “standard candle” test
technology.snippet: A new and powerful particle detector just passed a critical test in its goal to decipher the ingredients of the early universe. The sPHENIX detector is the newest experiment at Brookhaven National Laboratory's Relativistic Heavy Ion Collider (RHIC) and is designed to precisely measure products of high-speed particle collisions.

healthcare.title: At-home health tests have surged in popularity. But many are unclear and unreliable, UK report finds
healthcare.snippet: A UK report finds many at-home health tests are unclear and unreliable, prompting calls for more regulation to protect consumers and the healthcare system.

manufacturing.title: STC Advanced Manufacturing Technology students enter national competition
manufacturing.snippet: South Texas College Advanced Manufacturing Technology (AMT) students will participate in Project MFG's Advanced Manufacturing competition, testing their skills in machining, blueprint reading, and advanced manufacturing processes.

energy.title: Scientists help power world's largest fusion energy project
energy.snippet: Scientists from Durham University played a crucial role in verifying the quality of specialist materials for ITER's magnets, testing over 5,500 samples and conducting 13,000 measurements to ensure the magnets meet the project's strict standards.

automotive.title: BNCAP gaining global credibility as automakers opt for testing in India: Nitin Gadkari
automotive.snippet: Global automobile companies have begun sending their vehicles to India for testing under the Bharat New Car Assessment Programme (BNCAP), highlighting the growing credibility of the country's safety regime.

automotive.title: Chinese test of driving-aid tech sees 'children' struck repeatedly
automotive.snippet: A recent Chinese test of autonomous vehicle technology revealed that even the latest Advanced Driver-Assistance Systems (ADAS) struggle to handle complex traffic situations, with many vehicles failing to avoid collisions with child mannequins.

automotive.title: Car Safety Awards Will Require Driver Monitoring Tech
automotive.snippet: The Insurance Institute for Highway Safety's Top Safety Pick+ award will soon require cars to have driver monitoring technology to earn the distinction.

Apple.title: Apple Executives Showcase the iPhone Air's Resilience
Apple.snippet: At the recent unveiling of the iPhone 17, Apple emphasized the remarkable durability of its new iPhone Air model, garnering significant media interest.  Apple has incorporated a grade 5 titanium frame, setting this model apart from its aluminum counterparts. The company asserts that the iPhone Air not only meets but surpasses its stringent bend test criteria.

Google.title: Google's Search Test Exposes How Little It Cares About News: Key Points To Know
Google.snippet: Google conducted a test removing news from search results for 1% of users in eight European markets for 2.5 months.  The experiment suggested that news is not important to Google's ad-based business.

Microsoft.title: Microsoft suspends testing of new features in Windows 11 test builds due to persistent problems
Microsoft.snippet: Microsoft has suspended testing of some new Windows 11 features to "investigate several issues" found in the Dev channel (build 26120.961). Voice-related features have been disabled, such as Narrator.

Amazon.title: Amazon Tests GM BrightDrop EV Delivery Vans
Amazon.snippet: Amazon is testing General Motors' BrightDrop electric vans as part of its effort to reduce carbon emissions in its delivery operations.  The test involves a small number of vehicles and is part of a broader strategy to have 100,000 electric delivery vehicles on the road by 2030.

Tesla.title: Tesla lands regulatory green light for Robotaxi testing in new state
Tesla.snippet: Tesla has officially received approval from the Nevada DMV to start testing autonomous vehicles (robotaxis) on public roads.

Johnson & Johnson.title: Johnson & Johnson reaches $700 million settlement in talc baby powder case
Johnson & Johnson.snippet: Johnson & Johnson reached a $700 million settlement in a talc baby powder case. More than 50,000 claims have been filed against the company, mostly on behalf of women who developed ovarian cancer.

Johnson & Johnson.title: Johnson & Johnson baby powder recalled in US over asbestos traces
Johnson & Johnson.snippet: Johnson & Johnson's baby powder was recalled in the US due to the detection of asbestos traces.  This followed numerous lawsuits alleging the product caused cancer.

Johnson & Johnson.title: Dr Reddy's signs pact with J&J to acquire vertigo treatment brand
Johnson & Johnson.snippet: Dr Reddy's Laboratories announced the completion of a definitive transaction with Johnson & Johnson to acquire Stugeron brand across the EMEA regions, with India and Vietnam as key markets. Stugeron contains Cinnarizine, an antihistamine indicated for the treatment of vestibular disturbances and vertigo.

SEC.title: Vanderbilt visits No. 11 South Carolina in early SEC test
SEC.snippet: Vanderbilt, looking to prove its 2024 success wasn't a fluke, faces a tough SEC opener against No. 11 South Carolina.  The Gamecocks' offense has struggled, while Vanderbilt's strong rushing attack will be a key test for South Carolina's defense.

FDA.title: FDA Accepts FibroScan Letter of Intent for Surrogate Endpoint in MASH Trials
FDA.snippet: The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA)'s Center for Drug Evaluation and Research, Office of New Drugs has accepted Echosense' Letter of Intent for the qualification of Liver Stiffness Measurement (LSM) by Vibration-Controlled Transient Elastography (VCTE; FibroScan) as a reasonably likely surrogate endpoint in clinical trials for metabolic dysfunction-associated steatohepatitis (MASH).

FTC.title: FTC Launches Investigation Into Big Tech Over AI Chatbot Safety For Children—Meta, OpenAI, Musk's xAI Among Targets
FTC.snippet: The Federal Trade Commission on Thursday launched an investigation into Alphabet, Meta, Elon Musk's xAI, OpenAI and other firms over how they safeguard children and teens from potentially negative impacts of their artificial intelligence chatbots.

GDPR.title: Study finds GDPR reduced value but increased cybersecurity
GDPR.snippet: A recent study looking at the effects of the European Union's General Data Protection Regulation found that companies required to comply with the act lost market value in the week it became enforceable but, at the same time, suffered fewer data breaches in the long term.

CCPA.title: California AG Issues Highest Fine to Date for CCPA Violations
CCPA.snippet: The California Office of the Attorney General (OAG) announced a settlement against Healthline, which included the largest CCPA settlement to date – $1.55 million.  The violations included failing to opt consumers out of the sharing of their personal information for targeted advertising, violating the Purpose Limitation Principle, failing to maintain CCPA-required contracts, and deceiving consumers about privacy practices.
